GOD.content: ethical must sometimes be refused in name of responsibility that doesn’t calculate, that keeps its secret, that tyrannically [Nietzsche], jealously refuses violence of accounts and justifications, declining autobiography that is auto-justification: egodicée
GOD.linkedContent: ethical must sometimes be refused in name of responsibility that doesn’t calculate, that keeps its secret, that tyrannically [Nietzsche], jealously refuses violence of accounts and justifications, declining autobiography that is auto-justification: egodicée

GOD.content: secrecy essential to sacrificial responsibility, absolute, infinite, duty in name of God as tout autre, who must remain transcendent, hidden, secret, jealous of love, commands he gives
GOD.linkedContent: secrecy essential to sacrificial responsibility, absolute, infinite, duty in name of God as tout autre, who must remain transcendent, hidden, secret, jealous of love, commands he gives

GOD.content: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and concealed, jealously guarded: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?
GOD.linkedContent: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and concealed, jealously guarded: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?

GOD.content: whenever one asks for pardon, God is part of it: divine retraction as God observing human desire, not jealousy
GOD.linkedContent: whenever one asks for pardon, God is part of it: divine retraction as God observing human desire, not jealousy

MONL.content: division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing: place of jealousy divided btwn vengeance and resentment.
MONL.linkedContent: division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing: place of jealousy divided btwn vengeance and resentment.

MONL.content: terror inside language; p. 24 nothing but jealousy unleashed, “[language] takes its revenge at the heart of the law”
MONL.linkedContent: terror inside language; p. 24 nothing but jealousy unleashed, “[language] takes its revenge at the heart of the law”

MONL.content: no absolute appropriation/reappropriation because no natural property of language, only appropriative madness, jealousy without appropriation [see p. 63]
MONL.linkedContent: no absolute appropriation/reappropriation because no natural property of language, only appropriative madness, jealousy without appropriation [see p. 63]

MONL.content: is language not born of vindictive jealous?
MONL.linkedContent: is language not born of vindictive jealous?

POO.content: “the secret remains intact, my politeness [see S p. 8] unblemished, my reserve unbreached, my modesty more jealous than ever [see TB p. 124]” [respond w/out responding]
POO.linkedContent: “the secret remains intact, my politeness [see S p. 8] unblemished, my reserve unbreached, my modesty more jealous than ever [see TB p. 124]” [respond w/out responding]

MPM.content: de Man on Baudelaire: représentation du présent [re: memory of present] combines incompatibility of repetitive & instantaneous pattern (tension); Baudelaire faithful to seduction of the present; for him, memory applies more to present that past
MPM.linkedContent: de Man on Baudelaire: représentation du présent [re: memory of present] combines incompatibility of repetitive & instantaneous pattern (tension); Baudelaire faithful to seduction of the present; for him, memory applies more to present that past

A.content: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time
A.linkedContent: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time

A.content: jealousy: primitive passion for the proper, for proper possibility re: one’s existence
A.linkedContent: jealousy: primitive passion for the proper, for proper possibility re: one’s existence

OH.content: Valéry: capital would consume Frenchmen w/ “concentration camp” of jealousy
OH.linkedContent: Valéry: capital would consume Frenchmen w/ “concentration camp” of jealousy

PAS.content: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt
PAS.linkedContent: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt

PAS.content: structure of name, text, signature complicates premises when one precipitates oneself toward the guarantee of filiation [does jealousy always overdetermine?]
PAS.linkedContent: structure of name, text, signature complicates premises when one precipitates oneself toward the guarantee of filiation [does jealousy always overdetermine?]

LOBL.content: “the initial [re: J.] keeps (garde) the secret like a grave—jealously”
LOBL.linkedContent: “the initial [re: J.] keeps (garde) the secret like a grave—jealously”

LOBL.content: Blanchot on watching “her” approach a truth “compared to which mine lost all interest”
LOBL.linkedContent: Blanchot on watching “her” approach a truth “compared to which mine lost all interest”

HERP.content: for Heidegger, Heraclitus and poets [?] experience lovence (aimance), before philosophy, love w/out strife before Eros, desire, or, at least, a jealous tension
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Heraclitus and poets [?] experience lovence (aimance), before philosophy, love w/out strife before Eros, desire, or, at least, a jealous tension

HERP.content: moment of question as struggle, moment of Eros when philosophy becomes a question tensed/plunged into mourning, jealous/inquisitive about being?
HERP.linkedContent: moment of question as struggle, moment of Eros when philosophy becomes a question tensed/plunged into mourning, jealous/inquisitive about being?

BL.content: text [Kafka’s] jealously guards its inconsistent content, brings reader before the law > endless differance until death
BL.linkedContent: text [Kafka’s] jealously guards its inconsistent content, brings reader before the law > endless differance until death

BL.content: neither arrives no lets anyone arrive
BL.linkedContent: neither arrives no lets anyone arrive

POOF.content: friends of solitude, jealous friends of solitude, jealous of his secret w/out secret, share what can’t be shared, jealous of ‘proper & profound solitude of midday-midnight’ [of singularity]: beyond good conscience, friendship w/ new philosophers
POOF.linkedContent: friends of solitude, jealous friends of solitude, jealous of his secret w/out secret, share what can’t be shared, jealous of ‘proper & profound solitude of midday-midnight’ [of singularity]: beyond good conscience, friendship w/ new philosophers

POOF.content: Nietzsche: today we even need to be scarecrows, insofar as we are jealous friends of our most midday/midnight solitude > “friends of solitude” even called to be conjurers
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: today we even need to be scarecrows, insofar as we are jealous friends of our most midday/midnight solitude > “friends of solitude” even called to be conjurers

POOF.content: Nietzsche on ‘love’ denounces the right to property, love of thy neighbor as desire for more possessions, ‘love’ is the cupidity of possessing > ‘love btwn the sexes’ is egotism itself, jealousy that tends only toward possession (Besitzen)—[this love spawned from Christian friendship?]
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche on ‘love’ denounces the right to property, love of thy neighbor as desire for more possessions, ‘love’ is the cupidity of possessing > ‘love btwn the sexes’ is egotism itself, jealousy that tends only toward possession (Besitzen)—[this love spawned from Christian friendship?]

POOF.content: Nietzsche advocates another love, a love more loving than love, whose ‘just name’ would be friendship
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche advocates another love, a love more loving than love, whose ‘just name’ would be friendship

POOF.content: [offering quasi-summary of HERP] moment that originary [Heraclitean] phileîn (accord, favour, solicitude Gunst) becomes jealous, nostalgic tension ‘determined by Eros [órexis]’: the step to philosophy, prepared by sophistry [Plato, Socrates] > is the strange voice of the friend, an ontological call [prior to subject, consciousness, even to Mitsein? see p. 243], interior & w/out, the “what is…?” of philosophy [?]
POOF.linkedContent: [offering quasi-summary of HERP] moment that originary [Heraclitean] phileîn (accord, favour, solicitude Gunst) becomes jealous, nostalgic tension ‘determined by Eros [órexis]’: the step to philosophy, prepared by sophistry [Plato, Socrates] > is the strange voice of the friend, an ontological call [prior to subject, consciousness, even to Mitsein? see p. 243], interior & w/out, the “what is…?” of philosophy [?]

POOF.content: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note
POOF.linkedContent: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note

POOF.content: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía
POOF.linkedContent: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía

POOF.content: is there a worse jealousy than jealousy of self? is there any other? jealous of one’s very own brother: qui est le plus d’un, le supplément de l’un en trop? [the friend, says Nietzsche’s hermit]
POOF.linkedContent: is there a worse jealousy than jealousy of self? is there any other? jealous of one’s very own brother: qui est le plus d’un, le supplément de l’un en trop? [the friend, says Nietzsche’s hermit]

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s hermit too attracted to the depths, nostalgic for elevation—dreams of a friend to gain altitude > friend’s nostalgia: wish to believe in other, wishing in vain to believe in ourselves > Derrida links this nostalgia to the Heideggerian nostalgia at origin of philosophical philía: elle nourrit [fires?] donc l’envie à l’égard de l’autre comme de nous-mêmes, we envy each other, love as the attempt to leap beyond this envy
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s hermit too attracted to the depths, nostalgic for elevation—dreams of a friend to gain altitude > friend’s nostalgia: wish to believe in other, wishing in vain to believe in ourselves > Derrida links this nostalgia to the Heideggerian nostalgia at origin of philosophical philía: elle nourrit [fires?] donc l’envie à l’égard de l’autre comme de nous-mêmes, we envy each other, love as the attempt to leap beyond this envy

POOF.content: in face of our envy, the aggression whereby nous nous faisons un ennemi, make ourselves our own enemy: hides/reveals our vulnerability > true fear/respect [?]: “At least be my enemy!”
POOF.linkedContent: in face of our envy, the aggression whereby nous nous faisons un ennemi, make ourselves our own enemy: hides/reveals our vulnerability > true fear/respect [?]: “At least be my enemy!”

S.content: origin as hétérogène à l’origine: 1) originarily heterogenous 2) heterogenous to what is called the origin, other than the origin 3) heterogenous and or insofar as at the origin: because and although (bien que) at the same time—is logical form of tension that makes this thought vibrate
S.linkedContent: origin as hétérogène à l’origine: 1) originarily heterogenous 2) heterogenous to what is called the origin, other than the origin 3) heterogenous and or insofar as at the origin: because and although (bien que) at the same time—is logical form of tension that makes this thought vibrate

F.content: Abraham & Torok: [Wolf Man’s] jouissance jealously preserved (gardée) in his inner safe (for)
F.linkedContent: Abraham & Torok: [Wolf Man’s] jouissance jealously preserved (gardée) in his inner safe (for)

FWT.content: s’en prendre, a kind of love, homage, taking on, attacking
FWT.linkedContent: s’en prendre, a kind of love, homage, taking on, attacking

FWT.content: btwn French language & me there will have been, will be, more love [i.e. more than Lacan], mad love, reciprocal jealousy [i.e. insane idea that French language is jealous of Derrida]
FWT.linkedContent: btwn French language & me there will have been, will be, more love [i.e. more than Lacan], mad love, reciprocal jealousy [i.e. insane idea that French language is jealous of Derrida]

FWT.content: nationalism always state-nationalism today: a zealous, jealous, vindictive vindication of nation as a sovereign state
FWT.linkedContent: nationalism always state-nationalism today: a zealous, jealous, vindictive vindication of nation as a sovereign state

DS.content: [re: specificity of genres] to join mime & dancer (they should be allied but not confused), two attitudes jealous of their respective silences: this is to confront too much difference! (too close proximity)
DS.linkedContent: [re: specificity of genres] to join mime & dancer (they should be allied but not confused), two attitudes jealous of their respective silences: this is to confront too much difference! (too close proximity)

P.content: envy, jealousy, mortification at work w/in our affect > the beautiful this does w/out everything, w/out you, w/out its class [re: Kant’s free beauty]
P.linkedContent: envy, jealousy, mortification at work w/in our affect > the beautiful this does w/out everything, w/out you, w/out its class [re: Kant’s free beauty]

P.content: isn’t the frame exactly what Kant means by free-wandering beauty? but, unlike frame, that which is beautiful tends towards meaning, a tension, vection, rection that must be absolutely interrupted [from concept, end] to liberate beauty [not stopgap of sublime, though]
P.linkedContent: isn’t the frame exactly what Kant means by free-wandering beauty? but, unlike frame, that which is beautiful tends towards meaning, a tension, vection, rection that must be absolutely interrupted [from concept, end] to liberate beauty [not stopgap of sublime, though]

ROP.content: resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely
ROP.linkedContent: resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely

ATIA.content: disavowal of being seen by the animal [Derrida believes it has happened to Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, Kant] > jealous of, anxious about, what is proper to man
ATIA.linkedContent: disavowal of being seen by the animal [Derrida believes it has happened to Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, Kant] > jealous of, anxious about, what is proper to man

WAP.linkedContent: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)

WAP.content: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)

TB.linkedContent: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly

TB.content: untouchable: fascinates, orients work of translator

text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact) [cf. POO p. 144n my modesty more jealous than ever] (untouchable remnant stays in tact)

DPi.content: theater of cruelty, scopic drive, fascinatio, enchantment that chains spectator to spectacle (fascio, to tense, tie, attach, fasciola is a bandage wrapping [bandelette]) > what links voyeur-spectator to fascinum, charm, enchantment, virile sex
DPi.linkedContent: theater of cruelty, scopic drive, fascinatio, enchantment that chains spectator to spectacle (fascio, to tense, tie, attach, fasciola is a bandage wrapping [bandelette]) > what links voyeur-spectator to fascinum, charm, enchantment, virile sex

DPi.content: to executioner: “so, you got a hard-on! (tu bandes!)” (link to erection at moment of decapitation)
DPi.linkedContent: to executioner: “so, you got a hard-on! (tu bandes!)” (link to erection at moment of decapitation)

CHM.content: silence as madness: irreducible role of haunting language, outside and against which alone language can emerge: “against” designating 1) content from which form takes off by force 2) adversary against which I assure/reassure myself by force [jealous friends of solitude]
CHM.linkedContent: silence as madness: irreducible role of haunting language, outside and against which alone language can emerge: “against” designating 1) content from which form takes off by force 2) adversary against which I assure/reassure myself by force [jealous friends of solitude]

C.content: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition
C.linkedContent: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition

C.content: hermetically closed (portable temples called hermes): mute beneath its altuglassed transparency, seduces, attracts the dead man, makes him come back and more: fors in that casket
C.linkedContent: hermetically closed (portable temples called hermes): mute beneath its altuglassed transparency, seduces, attracts the dead man, makes him come back and more: fors in that casket

LI.content: parasite can never be excluded from body “proper” > “an owner” calls it parasite (jealously defending his oikos) > whatever violently “takes place” always something of a parasite, offered hospitality, a place, by host: never quite taking place is part of parasite’s success as an event
LI.linkedContent: parasite can never be excluded from body “proper” > “an owner” calls it parasite (jealously defending his oikos) > whatever violently “takes place” always something of a parasite, offered hospitality, a place, by host: never quite taking place is part of parasite’s success as an event

LI.content: Derrida’s “conservatism”: I am for safeguards, memory, jealous conservation of #s of traditions (in university & in scientific, philosophical, literary theory) > I am actively committed to safeguards: at same time (in same text), I call into question foundation of these traditions
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s “conservatism”: I am for safeguards, memory, jealous conservation of #s of traditions (in university & in scientific, philosophical, literary theory) > I am actively committed to safeguards: at same time (in same text), I call into question foundation of these traditions

LI.content: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs
LI.linkedContent: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs

LI.content: without this tension, contradiction, could anything be done? change?
LI.linkedContent: without this tension, contradiction, could anything be done? change?

TN.content: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung

NOY.content: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity
NOY.linkedContent: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity

NOY.content: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second” ——yes, (already but always) faithful countersignature, can’t be counted: it always sends itself off in number (il s’envoie toujours en nombre)

ATM.content: “je donne, je joue l’ingratitude contre la jalousie,” if God is exempt from jealousy (no desire for possession) must he not guard this exemption jealously, and in so doing lose himself? > ellipse de jalousie: le sans-jalousie se garde jalousement, autrement dit se perd, se-garde-se-perd: plus de jalousie [seriasure always a jealous, series of traits & retraits, beyond the face]
ATM.linkedContent: “je donne, je joue l’ingratitude contre la jalousie,” if God is exempt from jealousy (no desire for possession) must he not guard this exemption jealously, and in so doing lose himself? > ellipse de jalousie: le sans-jalousie se garde jalousement, autrement dit se perd, se-garde-se-perd: plus de jalousie [seriasure always a jealous, series of traits & retraits, beyond the face]

ATM.content: WE NEED A NEW BODY, UN AUTRE SANS PLUS DE JALOUSIE, THE MOST ANCIENT STILL (ENCORE) TO COME
ATM.linkedContent: WE NEED A NEW BODY, UN AUTRE SANS PLUS DE JALOUSIE, THE MOST ANCIENT STILL (ENCORE) TO COME

ATM.content: Levinas: “to shelter the other in one’s own land or home, to tolerate the presence of the landless and homeless on the ‘ancestral soil,’ so jealously, so meanly loved—is that the criterion of humanness? unquestionably so”
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas: “to shelter the other in one’s own land or home, to tolerate the presence of the landless and homeless on the ‘ancestral soil,’ so jealously, so meanly loved—is that the criterion of humanness? unquestionably so”

CF.content: States remain jealous of their own sovereignty in limiting that of others [re: Gulf war]; for Arendt, sovereignty only imposed where it’s ‘possible,’ imposed on the weak by the strong
CF.linkedContent: States remain jealous of their own sovereignty in limiting that of others [re: Gulf war]; for Arendt, sovereignty only imposed where it’s ‘possible,’ imposed on the weak by the strong

BSi.content: force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)
BSi.linkedContent: force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)

BSi.content: Valéry wagers on CAP: le cap Pensée; the high point (comble) of internal politics, a multipli-city of selves, when the excess that exceeds un-counts the other & outside > jealousy is always the hight point that completes me, supplements me because receives, welcomes, no longer chases out other in me: one only ever jealous of oneself, the selfsame > explains all the loves and wars (which take place btwn the same, the others as the same): as soon as there’s a double capitalized phallic erection (CAP, standing, being on a cape) here called Thought
BSi.linkedContent: Valéry wagers on CAP: le cap Pensée; the high point (comble) of internal politics, a multipli-city of selves, when the excess that exceeds un-counts the other & outside > jealousy is always the hight point that completes me, supplements me because receives, welcomes, no longer chases out other in me: one only ever jealous of oneself, the selfsame > explains all the loves and wars (which take place btwn the same, the others as the same): as soon as there’s a double capitalized phallic erection (CAP, standing, being on a cape) here called Thought

BSi.content: the World Trade Center as image of Valéry’s double capitalized phallic erection (jealous of themselves) > double turn makes one think of double tower (tour)
BSi.linkedContent: the World Trade Center as image of Valéry’s double capitalized phallic erection (jealous of themselves) > double turn makes one think of double tower (tour)

BSi.content: logos or legein as gathering (more originary than logos as reason/logic) still deploys force/violence, a Durchwalten of physis > physis as Gewalt: deployment of sovereignty, of force [of logos] (no dissolving into void), in the highest acuity of its (sovereign) tension (Spannung)
BSi.linkedContent: logos or legein as gathering (more originary than logos as reason/logic) still deploys force/violence, a Durchwalten of physis > physis as Gewalt: deployment of sovereignty, of force [of logos] (no dissolving into void), in the highest acuity of its (sovereign) tension (Spannung)

OG.content: for Rousseau, jealousy, a creation of culture, an arresting of nature by woman, stratagem of femininity > invention of culture denatures pity [which should reach out to every living thing]
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, jealousy, a creation of culture, an arresting of nature by woman, stratagem of femininity > invention of culture denatures pity [which should reach out to every living thing]

OG.content: jealousy marks the gap btwn pity/love

ATAP.content: agogic function of leader, il Duce, Führer, mystagogue, jealously protects unveiling of secret: elite beings, distinguished subjects [Donald Trump]
ATAP.linkedContent: agogic function of leader, il Duce, Führer, mystagogue, jealously protects unveiling of secret: elite beings, distinguished subjects [Donald Trump]

CIR.content: I know, dead jealous, I am not the contemporary of those I mentioned yesterday: I belong to the blind man blackmailing me
CIR.linkedContent: I know, dead jealous, I am not the contemporary of those I mentioned yesterday: I belong to the blind man blackmailing me

CIR.content: secret I’m jealously seeking as last word of my jealousy, continually turning around it w/out knowing secret of my suffering
CIR.linkedContent: secret I’m jealously seeking as last word of my jealousy, continually turning around it w/out knowing secret of my suffering

CIR.content: escarre [mother’s bedsore], oh my jealousy, as long as I have not sutured you, I have not understood you, escarre closes on blood of new skin > as long as I have not written Of the indubitable foundation or the cogito of my jealousy, or again The Confessions of a Mother, I will have failed my life & written nothing: unfathomable perjury, incurable facial paralysis, mask, etc.
CIR.linkedContent: escarre [mother’s bedsore], oh my jealousy, as long as I have not sutured you, I have not understood you, escarre closes on blood of new skin > as long as I have not written Of the indubitable foundation or the cogito of my jealousy, or again The Confessions of a Mother, I will have failed my life & written nothing: unfathomable perjury, incurable facial paralysis, mask, etc.

CIR.content: day of circumcision: a de-cision was taken in me w/out me > Jealousy & virginity, my two nipples
CIR.linkedContent: day of circumcision: a de-cision was taken in me w/out me > Jealousy & virginity, my two nipples

CIR.content: in all the history of humanity, have never known anyone happier, luckier, more euphoric than I (isn’t this a priori true?) > and yet [double bind] remained counterexample of myself: sad, deprived, neurotic, jealous, disappointed
CIR.linkedContent: in all the history of humanity, have never known anyone happier, luckier, more euphoric than I (isn’t this a priori true?) > and yet [double bind] remained counterexample of myself: sad, deprived, neurotic, jealous, disappointed

EU.content: Descartes jealously insists on adding “true philosophy” to Hardy’s universal language [he (Descartes) acts similarly w/ Augustine and St. Anselm?] > stakes must be serious wherever there’s violent defamation, never forget this
EU.linkedContent: Descartes jealously insists on adding “true philosophy” to Hardy’s universal language [he (Descartes) acts similarly w/ Augustine and St. Anselm?] > stakes must be serious wherever there’s violent defamation, never forget this

SPEC.content: reality principle’s end (autonomy): cut off from all pleasure, from all auto-affective relation, in service of a pleasure too jealous of itself, that would asphyxiate itself
SPEC.linkedContent: reality principle’s end (autonomy): cut off from all pleasure, from all auto-affective relation, in service of a pleasure too jealous of itself, that would asphyxiate itself

SPEC.content: [re: Ernst’s fort/da] double sending away (renvoi): whether father required to stay or go, mother is desired: “exclusive possession” [Freud & Ernst distance themselves from name of father, for Freud it is the name of the son-in-law]
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Ernst’s fort/da] double sending away (renvoi): whether father required to stay or go, mother is desired: “exclusive possession” [Freud & Ernst distance themselves from name of father, for Freud it is the name of the son-in-law]

SPEC.content: mother (woman) easier to possess/preserve when dead [?]—jealousy appeased
SPEC.linkedContent: mother (woman) easier to possess/preserve when dead [?]—jealousy appeased

SPEC.content: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic
SPEC.linkedContent: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic

SPEC.content: exemplary narcissistic wound [for Freud]: jealousy over birth of new baby, proof of infidelity of object of child's affection, undoes (défait) the bind (lien) (Bindung) to parent of opposite sex
SPEC.linkedContent: exemplary narcissistic wound [for Freud]: jealousy over birth of new baby, proof of infidelity of object of child's affection, undoes (défait) the bind (lien) (Bindung) to parent of opposite sex

SPEC.content: [via Freud] program of all jealousies, model of betrayal: birth of the other child
SPEC.linkedContent: [via Freud] program of all jealousies, model of betrayal: birth of the other child

SPEC.content: whatever becomes too familiar can be suspected of jealously guarding a secret [re: Aristophanes’ speech in Symposium]
SPEC.linkedContent: whatever becomes too familiar can be suspected of jealously guarding a secret [re: Aristophanes’ speech in Symposium]

SPEC.content: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?

CHOR.content: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?
CHOR.linkedContent: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?
